channel.title: Apartment Therapy | Saving the world, one room at a time
channel.description: Saving the world, one room at a time

item.title: Positively Primary: Knoll, Tulip Lamp & Persian Rug — The Monday Afternoon Scavenger
item.description:
You're looking at the building blocks of color right here, my friends. Just take it from here.
  • Pasadena, CA: Dorothy Schindele Dining Chairs - $3000
  • New York, NY: Knoll Lovegrove Table - $1500
  • Chicago, IL: 1960s Stemlite Tulip Lamp - $50
  • Walpole, MA: Upholstered Ottoman - $175
  • Asheville, NC: Persian Rug - $825
    More
item.author: Dabney Frake

item.title: Design With Benefits — Store Profile
item.description:
Architects Tania Garber and Ida Polzer want to mix good design with good stewardship. Their new webshop, Design With Benefits, offers unique, high design accessories that are socially and environmentally conscious. We're talking radios from an Indonesian plant that teaches former farmers craftsmanship skills and jewelry made from a salvaged historic Frank Lloyd Wright roof. Fun stuff!

More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Lindsay's 7 1/2 Floor Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Lindsay
Location:
Pittsburgh, PA
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
I love that I'm the first person to utilize this small forgotten space since this home was built in 1884. I adore feeling like I'm sleeping in John Malkovich's 7 1/2 floor. Even though I'm just a renter, I completely designed, insulated, and remodeled this not-tall-enough-to-stand-in space myself (along with the help of a friend).


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: My Life Without a Dishwasher — Renters Solutions
item.description:
My current flat has a dishwasher, which, after 5+ years of living in London without one, felt like a huge luxury when I moved in a year ago. In my naivety, I thought I'd become so used to and efficient at washing my own dishes that I'd barely use the thing. Yeah, you can guess how long that attitude lasted.

More
item.author: Eleanor Busing

item.title: Facebook Statuses Turned Absurdist Art — Design News 03.25.13
item.description:
Joining a group, tagging people in photos, and updating relationship statuses are digital second nature. Artist Nicolas Ritter created the photo series "The Social Network" to reimagine those likes and clicks into scenarios in the physical world. Needless to say, gaining a new level in Mafia Wars has a very different meaning.

In other news, Evernote expands internationally, and Bon Jovi lists his SoHo penthouse for $42 million. See the headlines after the jump.

More
item.author: Tara Bellucci

item.title: Brit's Renovated Space Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Brit
Location:
Seattle, WA
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
I love that my fiance and I created the space together. From tearing down walls, rebuilding the stairs, putting in new doors, placing LED lights under the stairs, picking out reclaimed wood for the closets and floors, painting the walls together... you name it and we did it! (And I had NO experience!)


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: LA Vintage Furnishings' Fully Stocked Shop — Apartment Therapy Classifieds Seller Spotlight
item.description:
With 162 listings, LA Vintage Furnishings is definitely one of the most prolific users of the Apartment Therapy Classifieds. The items in their corner of the Classifieds range from Louis XVI to mid-century modern, with a little bit of everything in between.

More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: The Heartbreak of Giving Up a Rent-Controlled Apartment
item.description:
In the 7 years I've lived in San Francisco, my rent has only increased by 7%. My rent is half the city average for a studio apartment and a few hundred less than the price of a room in a multi-bedroom apartment, so though it is near the max of what I can afford to pay, it is a hell of a deal. Any bets on how much the rent will increase when I move out this summer? 

More
item.author: Tess Wilson

item.title: Bedding Basics: Mattress Pads
item.description:
Mattress pads serve a few purposes. First, of course, they help protect your mattress, providing a layer between your bedding and the mattress, which will help prolong the life of it. They also add an extra layer of cushion to the top of your mattress. 

More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Katie's Quotable Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Katie
Location:
Staunton, VA
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
I love how warm and inviting my bedroom is and I love the natural light that comes in. My favorite thing is the Mark Twain quote on my wall, which reminds me of my home state, Missouri, where Twain is from.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Signature Sofas: Chiclet, Henredon & Chesterfield Sofas — The Monday Morning Scavenger
item.description:
Nothing neutral here. These aren't the type of sofas that blend in; they want to - and do - get noticed.

  • San Francisco, CA: Regency Style Sofa - $1100
  • Washington, DC: Chiclet Sofa - $650

item.author: Dabney Frake

item.title: Before & After: A Mini Porch Makeover — The Rooster and the Hen
item.description:
I love a good porch. Maybe that's because I don't have one (and am dreaming of the day), but this one really caught my eye! At first, not terrible, but definitely not dazzling.

More
item.author: Andie Powers

item.title: Hopping Down the Bunny Trail: A Roundup of Easter Decor Ideas
item.description: We're planning our (first!) big Easter egg hunt next weekend. I've been absolutely obsessing over the marvelous details that can accompany this wonderful holiday. As inspiration, I've gathered together lots of fun decoration ideas we've featured in the past here at Apartment Therapy: More
item.author: Elisabeth Wilborn

item.title: Piano Meets Keyboard: An Old Piano Transformed Into a Desk — Backstage Design Studio
item.description: We're constantly amazed at the insanely crazy creative ways people re-make their old, well-loved possessions (or lucky flea market finds) into completely new pieces. Do-overs like this one proves just as art lives on forever, so can the instruments used to create it. A piano on it's way to the dump found new life in the offices of a music industry design house. More
item.author: Taryn Fiol

item.title: Rachel's Heirloom History Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Rachel
Location:
Toronto Canada
Division:
International
What do you love about your bedroom?:
I love that our bedroom carries a beautiful history. It lies in our DIY headboard. It’s a solid mahogany family heirloom of 70+ years. During the German invasion of Czechoslovakia in the 30’s, my husband’s mother’s parents fled to Africa where they lived in Nigeria, running a rubber plantation and eventually migrated to Toronto, Canada. Their possessions were packed in 23 crates of solid mahogany. His grandfather’s plan was to use it to build furniture for their home once they settled. This piece was given to my husband as the largest remaining piece. The stunning brass swing arm wall lamps we got from a family friend, adds just the perfect light to show the stunning grain in the wood. We purposely chose white walls and no artwork so that the headboard is always given the respect it deserves. The headboard is the artwork. My mother gave me the bedspread from a trip to India. We love that the combined effect marries the history of all our family roots together.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: 5 Habits For Keeping Clear Countertops
item.description:
Getting countertops cleared is easy, right? But what about keeping them that way for more than a day? Now, that's the tricky part! Here are five habits that can help keep your countertops clear and make for more enjoyable cooking

• Clear Countertops
  The Kitchn
item.author: Cambria Bold

item.title: Find Your Favorites: Sunday's Entries — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
It's Sunday night and you're probably mentally preparing yourself for your work week. Before you get bogged down in that, take a minute to click through today's Bedroom Contest entries. Check them out and if you like what you see, be sure to click the heart on their post to make them a "favorite" and help move them up on the leaderboard.

  • Danielle's Rich Purple Bedroom
  • Haley's Happy & Bright Bedroom
  • Jenn's Soothing Elements Bedroom
  • Naimah's Space to Dance Bedroom
  • Jeana's Perfect Peacock Bedroom
  • Mojca's Carpe Diem Bedroom
  • Jodi's Modern Rustic Bedroom
  • Michelle's Natural & Neutral Bedroom
  • SarahRose's Newlywed Bedroom
  • Kate's Reading Nook Bedroom
  • Chelsea's Cozy Retreat Bedroom
  • Hanna's Feels Like Home Bedroom
  • Maura's Calm Oasis Bedroom
  • Wakako's Earth Tones Bedroom

More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Wakako's Earth Tones Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Wakako
Location:
Los Angeles, CA
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
What I love about my bedroom is that it is isolated on the upper floor of my condo. The overall earthy tone and the giant palm makes it feel like a small retreat where I can relax with my husband and cats. The room also gets lots of natural light so I always feel bright and happy.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Maura's Calm Oasis Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Maura
Location:
East Greenwich, RI
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
The calm. We have two young children. Our bedroom is an oasis from the activity of the rest of the house, but kids are still welcome here. We have included spaces for their things too so they can cuddle with us in bed or read and play while we are getting ready in the morning. We also love our house’s eccentricities. Our house was built in 1959 and features like the mid century modern built in drawers and an intercom system are what made us fall head over heels for our house.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Hanna's Feels Like Home Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Hanna
Location:
Los Angeles, CA
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
This is the first bedroom that I've redone by myself that has truly felt like home. It's so comfortable, and there's always music playing. There is also at least one kitty on the bed at all times, which is a nice thing to come home to after a long day.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Chelsea's Cozy Retreat Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Chelsea
Location:
Lincoln City, OR
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
The white walls! They are so conforming to everything. My style changes on a daily basis and probably the one thing that hasn't changed in this bedroom is the color of the walls. I love how bright they make the space, especially with the five windows! I also feel my bedroom is the perfect size. It's large enough for some extra furniture other than a bed but cozy enough so there is not a lot of wasted space.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Kate's Reading Nook Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Katie
Location:
Albany, NY
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
I love the natural light, and how easy it was to arrange my bedroom how I wanted. My reading nook is by my bay windows, not too far from my bed, but the fact that I have all of this space in a smaller than average bedroom is amazing. Plus, the view of Albany that I have is spectacular!


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: SarahRose's Newlywed Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
SarahRose
Location:
Chicago, IL
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
This is our newlywed's bedroom, and we feel intimate in our new space. I love how fresh and serene my bedroom is. It is bright in the morning, and the table lamps offer romantic lighting in the evening. It is uniquely ours. Having photos from our wedding, and our framed invite surrounding us make us so happy, just like our wedding day. I love the mix of geometrics and ikat, modern and traditional. I feel this combination creates a long-lasting design.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Michelle's Natural & Neutral Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Michelle
Location:
Pasadena, CA
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
I love that our bedroom gets a ton of natural light. Sometimes living in an apartment you are stuck with a tiny window and hardly any natural light. Our ceilings are high and we have neutral colored walls so the light just reflects in.


More
